name: Muslim Wellness Foundation
mission: Muslim Wellness Foundation (MWF) is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization dedicated to promoting healing and well-being in American Muslim communities through dialogue, education and training. The MWF approach to health is interdisciplinary, intergenerational, spiritually grounded, community based, and justice-oriented. From being the first Muslim organization in the country to offer Mental Health First Aid (MHFA) trainings to establishing the annual Black Muslim Psychology Conference (BMPC), MWF has been an outspoken leader in fostering visions for wellness and healing. Our programs demonstrate our keen awareness of the link between oppression, wellness and how communities heal, grow, thrive, and experience joy in the midst of it all. We will continue to lead the way in shifting the conversation on mental health, addiction and trauma - from one narrowly focused on stigma to a healing-centered model of collective well-being, faith, identity and belonging. Join us on this journey.
theoryOfChange: The MWF approach to health is interdisciplinary, intergenerational, spiritually grounded, community based, and justice-oriented, aiming to shift from stigma-focused models to healing-centered models of collective well-being.
zakatClaimEvidence: The Muslim Wellness Network website mentions 'Gifting' and 'Donate Now' but does not explicitly mention 'zakat' or dedicated zakat funds. (Source: https://muslimwellness.com/support-mwf-today)

dimension_explanations.alignment: With an alignment score of 29/50, the foundation addresses an urgent global health cause within a niche community [1].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates a direct approach to capacity building through MHFA trainings and the BMPC [3]. While it maintains a 100.0% program expense ratio, the impact score of 27/50 reflects a lack of available cost-per-beneficiary data and a low data confidence level of 0.23 [1][2].

baseline_narrative.headline: Muslim Wellness Foundation Inc is a nonprofit organization dedicated to promoting healing and emotional well-being within the American Muslim community through specialized mental health programming.
strengths: Allocates 100.0% of expenses directly to program services
High fundraising efficiency with $0.00 spent per $1 raised

baseline_narrative.summary: Muslim Wellness Foundation (MWF) focuses on community-based healing by providing Mental Health First Aid (MHFA) trainings and hosting the Black Muslim Psychology Conference (BMPC) [3][4]. The organization reported a total revenue of $223,205 and maintains a program expense ratio of 100.0% [1][2].
